page.title: 09Social Survey (Housing)
page.content: {77%}of the sample families live in housing less than 20 years old. A new estate built in the 1970s doubled the size of Sutton Benger. {15%}live in housing between 100 and 150 years old. Most of this was originally built for workers on the nearby Draycot estate. The newer housing is a good mix of 2, 3 and 4 bedroomed, terraced, semi- detached and detached homes, and the older properties are mainly in semi- detached pairs. {92%}of homes are owner occupied,{3% privately rented, and{5%}owned by the employers of agricultural workers. None of the sample rented from the Council although there is some Council housing in the Parish. The main heating methods are oil{45%; solid fuel{37%;}and electricity{18%. There is no gas supply in the area.
